timeline: Approximately 8 weeks after Chapter 10 decision (6 weeks renovation + 2 weeks operation)
location: Sector 4 Building 47 (the first Free Level building), Jax's office
characters_present: First residents including old man, mother with two children

knows: Bought Building 47 in Sector 4 for 12 million (worth ~50k in scrap)
Spent 90 million on renovation (total: 102 million)
Operating costs are 60 million per year (5 million per month)
All 20 units are full with waiting list of 47 names
People are deeply suspicious but coming anyway
Word is spreading through the undercity
He has enough money to run this for 5 years without selling more currency
Has billions more in Earth currency to sell
Property in Sector 6 is next target for expansion
Jax Varro.emotional_state: Purposeful, driven, finding meaning in building instead of escaping
Jax Varro.wealth: ~300 million liquid (spent ~100 million on Building 47), billions more in unsold currency
Jax Varro.transformation: From dealer to community builder, finding purpose in being trapped

knows: Running the kitchen three meals a day (08:00, 13:00, 19:00)
People think it's a cult, gang, or experiment
It's actually working despite suspicion
Jax is planning to expand to Sector 6
Waiting list has 47 names
Finn.emotional_state: Cautiously supportive, helpful, seeing Jax find purpose

knows: Was crew boss for renovation
Former maintenance worker laid off by station authority
Paid triple legal minimum wage by Jax
Initially suspicious it was gang recruitment or organ harvesting
Kara.background: Gamma with enhanced muscle density, experienced with old station infrastructure

knows: Running clinic three days a week (Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday)
Treating anyone without questions, reporting, or billing
Jax is attracting outlaws and fugitives (as predicted)
Being paid to provide free medical care
Dr. Yin.conditions: No reporting to authority, no genetic verification, no billing

revealed_to_reader: Building 47 in Sector 4 was condemned for 15 years before Jax bought it
Art deco architecture from station's first generation
Bought for 12 million from Beta property speculator doing tax write-offs
Ground floor: industrial kitchen, common area, medical clinic
Hired exclusively Gamma workers, paid triple legal minimum wage
Operating costs: 60 million per year (5 million per month)
No rent, no obligations, no contracts
Posted notices: 'FREE HOUSING AND MEALS - No cost. No contract. No catch.'
Everyone asks 'what's the catch' or 'what do you want'
Residents include: old man from collapsed hotel, mother with two children ages 4 and 7
People test food for drugs/poison, check doors for control, wait for revelation
Rumors: cult recruitment, gang operation, human experiments
Next expansion planned for Sector 6, budget 100 million

planted.significance: Potential recurring character, represents Gamma workers

planted.element: People testing food for poison, checking locks
Mother with two children finding safety
planted.significance: Emotional core, what this project means to vulnerable people

planted.element: Everyone asking 'why' and 'what do you want'
planted.significance: Sets up Mother Sera testing Jax's motives

planted.element: Attracting outlaws and fugitives (Dr. Yin's warning)

planted.significance: Shows their loyalty and partnership with Jax

active_tensions: Everyone's suspicion versus reality of free services
Sustainability of 60 million per year operating costs
47 people on waiting list needing housing
Word spreading = more attention (good and bad)
Question of what happens when money runs out
Paranoia slowly giving way to trust
Jax's transformation from dealer to builder
world_changes: Building 47 in Sector 4 is now operational Free Level facility
20 residents living in free housing with free meals and medical care
Word spreading through undercity about 'charity that might be real'
Jax has spent ~100 million of his fortune
Dr. Yin now working for Jax 3 days per week
Gamma workers were hired and paid triple minimum wage
continuity_notes: Timeline: ~8 weeks after Ch10 (6 week renovation, 2 weeks operation)
Building 47, Sector 4 is the first Free Level location
One two-bedroom unit mentioned for family (may be inaccuracy or custom renovation)
Jax has office in building, small room off common area
Operating cost: 5 million per month, 60 million per year
character_moments: Old man testing if it's real before accepting
Mother with children getting emotional when she realizes it's free
Kids seeing their own beds for first time
Finn hiding smile when Jax commits to expanding
Jax kneeling to talk to children at their eye level
Everyone asking 'why' and Jax giving honest answer about being trapped
